medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute-onset right lower quadrant abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began approximately 24 hours prior to presentation and has been associated with nausea and anorexia. He has tolerated a small amount of oral intake since the onset of symptoms. There were no fevers, chills, or night sweats, and he has been passing flatus with normal bowel movements, which contained no blood or mucus. There have been no previous episodes, and no relieving or exacerbating factors were identified.
